file_content.text: Slowly, we've begun to free the prisoners. We'll get them all eventually.
I have the prison records.
I did it.
Ah, let me see....
Registries, cell block numbers, access codes... it's all here. Perfect.
I'll have this information transmitted to every Imperial officer on Belsavis. I assume it all went smoothly?
There were Republic troopers waiting for me.
I was ambushed.
And yet you still managed to return? Impressive.
The New Men were every bit as tough as you said.
Those cyborgs can fight.
I'm not one for exaggeration. But you dealt with them swiftly enough.
It's in the past.
Quite.
You've guaranteed the freedom of countless Imperials. Our brothers and sisters will soon be free. Thank you.
Until our compatriots are released, I'm as much a prisoner of this planet as they are.
Seriously, Captain, you've got to stop sending your men down here. I'm running out of places to hide the bodies.
Then fight me, you coward! We'll see how long you--hello? Hello!?
My lord, you must do something! That madman is disrupting my mission and butchering my men.
You must put a stop to this. That madman is is disrupting my mission and butchering my men.
Don't presume to tell me my responsibilities, worm.
Watch your mouth.
I am Sith, Captain. Remember your station... and mine.
Careful.
Apologies, my lord, frustration impairs my judgment.
My obligations only stretch so far as my payment.
I'm not one of your troops.
I'm sure you'll find your services in high demand around here. There's certainly no shortage of killing to be done.
My duties are to the Empire first and your wounded pride last, Captain.
I don't answer to you.
But he... ah, you're right. Duty first.
Perhaps I ought to wipe that smirk from his face.
He won't be laughing for long.
A proper fate for anyone meddling in the Empire's affairs.
What is it you're trying to do here?
Your mission?
I've been pulled from more... civilized fronts to facilitate the release of our prisoners here.
This dungeon houses many loyal Imperials. My orders are to retrieve the prison records so we might find and liberate these patriots.
The problem is, a group of escaped cyborgs calling themselves "the New Men" have taken up residence where those records are kept. They're slaughtering my men.
Who are these "New Men"?
Cyborgs?
Misguided savages who revere the union of man and machine. I've heard they adorn their droids with their victims'... extremities.
I'll get those records.
My thanks. These New Men are making a mockery of me and my troops while the Empire's most trusted vassals rot in their cells.
Are a few prisoners really that important?
Is it even worth it?
Only the most feared enemies of the Republic are kept here. We need those people fighting for us again.
The names and locations of thousands of Imperial prisoners are stored in those records. We must obtain them.
My lord, I beseech you... you're the only one with the strength to get past those psychopaths.
Name your price, bounty hunter. Just get me those records.
Our comrades' freedom hangs in the balance, sir. Will you help them?
I am nearly at my wit's end. Please, bring me those records, if you can.
I'll show these upstarts the true might of the Sith Empire.
I'll deal with it.
It couldn't hurt to have an entire planet of captive Imperials indebted to me.
I could use the gratitude.
You sure you can afford my rate?
Danger isn't cheap.
Whatever you require.
The safety and security of our allies is paramount.
It must be done.
Well said.
Very well.
This task is a noble one, I assure you.
The records can be accessed via the central records terminal in the prisoner transfer station. The Republic may still have a presence there.
Remember, the New Men are the worst of the worst--cybernetically linked to each other, metal spines full of adrenals... try to shoot first.
Do it yourself. [Refuse quest]
This is hardly my forte, either. I was trained to fight the Republic, not corral trigger-happy lunatics.
I'd rather be fighting, I can tell you that.
